Uses of Class
acdp.exceptions.ACDPException

  • Packages that use ACDPException 
    Package Description
    acdp
    Contains the core interfaces needed to operate a database.
    acdp.design
    Contains classes for designing an ACDP database.
    acdp.exceptions
    Contains types of exceptions beyond Java's built-in exception types.

    • Uses of ACDPException in acdp

      Methods in acdp that throw ACDPException 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void ReadZone.close()
      Closes this read zone.
      void Unit.close()
      Rolls back any uncommitted write operations of this unit as well as any write operations that were executed and committed in any uncommitted nested units and closes this unit.
      void Unit.commit()
      Commits any yet uncommitted write operations of this unit as well as any yet uncommitted nested units in this unit.
      void Table.compactFL()
      Eliminates the unused memory blocks within the FL file space of this table and truncates the corresponding data file.
      void Table.compactVL()
      Eliminates the unused memory blocks within the VL file space of this table and truncates the corresponding data file.
      void Table.delete​(Ref ref)
      Deletes the referenced row from this table.
      Ref Table.insert​(java.lang.Object... values)
      Inserts the specified values into this table and returns the reference to the newly created row.
      Unit Database.openUnit()
      Opens a unit.
      void Table.truncate()
      Deletes all rows of this table and truncates the corresponding data files.
      void Table.update​(Ref ref, ColVal<?>... colVals)
      Updates the values of the specified columns of the referenced row with the specified new values.
      void Table.updateAll​(ColVal<?>... colVals)
      For each row of this table updates the values stored in the specified columns with the specified new values.
      <T> void Table.updateAllChangeValues​(Column<T> column, Table.ValueChanger<T> valueChanger)
      For each row of this table updates the value stored in the specified column with a value obtained from the specified value changer.
      <T> void Table.updateAllSupplyValues​(Column<T> column, Table.ValueSupplier<T> valueSupplier)
      For each row of this table updates the value stored in the specified column with a value obtained from the specified value supplier.

    • Uses of ACDPException in acdp.exceptions

      Subclasses of ACDPException in acdp.exceptions 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  ConsistencyException
      Thrown if the value of the consistency number given at the time a strongly typed database is opened differs from the value of the consistency number stored in the database layout.
      class  CreationException
      Thrown to indicate that an object can't be created due to any reason.
      class  CryptoException
      Thrown if there is a problem with data encryption or decryption.
      class  DanglingCommentException
      Thrown to indicate that a manually added comment in a layout read from a file or a stream is not properly followed or not followed at all by an entry or an element of a sequence.
      class  DeleteConstraintException
      Thrown if the user tries to delete a row with a reference count greater than zero which means that the row is referenced by this or some other row.
      class  IllegalReferenceException
      Thrown if a row reference is illegal.
      class  ImplementationRestrictionException
      Thrown if an exception due to an implementation restricition has occurred.
      class  IndentationException
      Thrown to indicate that the lines of text in a layout read from a file or a stream are not properly indented.
      class  IOFailureException
      Thrown to indicate that an I/O error has occurred.
      class  MaximumException
      Thrown if one of the maximum values specified in the nobsRowRef, nobsOutrowPtr and nobsRefCount fields of the table layout is violated.
      class  MissingEntryException
      Thrown to indicate that a layout is missing a requested entry.
      class  ShutdownException
      Thrown if the database is still used after it was closed.
      class  UnitBrokenException
      Thrown to indicate that the unit is broken.
